page.title: 01General Review
page.content: the area is part of rural East Devon, just over 20 miles east of Exeter and 7 miles north of of the south Devon coastline at Seaton. Most of the area is part of Widworthy parish with the other parts in the parishes of Shute and Colyton. The area is very undulating with numerous wooded areas and small farms connected by narrow Devon lanes. The general impression is one of quiet rural calm, where one is easily able to get away from urban scrawl and be thrilled by the ever changing vistas just around the next bend in the road. The two streams which cross the area are usually slow and meandering, and the roads, on the whole unclassified, narrow, winding and not going anywhere in particular. There is no major place of habitation, only Umborne could be classified as even a hamlet.
